title: Statistics and probabilty. No. 2 (TEFC)
creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, BBC-TV, Open University and Robert Clamp
brief_description: Begins with a consideration of the concept of mathematical probability related to the external world by associating probabilities of sample points with relative frequency with which outcomes occur. D.V. Lindley, University College, London, speaks about subjective probability.
creator_credit_for_label: Edward Goldwyn, BBC-TV, Open University and Robert Clamp
